title: Facebook Debuts Collab Music Video App To Compete With TikTok
text: Facebook is trying out a TikTok "Duets"-style app called Collab, according to a report from 9to5mac. Collab began testing in May on an invite-only basis and will allow users to see a feed of three 15-second independent videos playing in sync in a feed, according to the report.

title: Facebook, Twitter face British fines if fail on harmful content
text: Facebook, Twitter and TikTok face fines of up to 10% of turnover if they fail to remove and limit the spread of illegal content under laws proposed by Britain on Tuesday.

title: Amazon, Facebook, YouTube Among Targets in FTC Probe
text: Dec.14 -- The U.S. Federal Trade Commission issued an order for social media and streaming companies to hand over information on how they collect and use data. Mark Mahaney, managing director at RBC Capital Markets, talks about the order on "Bloomberg Technology.

title: FTC Mandates Data Collection Methods From Amazon, Facebook, TikTok
text: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has mandated that nine social media companies and streaming services — including Amazon, Facebook, TikTok, Reddit, and more — turn over information about how they collect data, according to a press release.

title: FTC orders social media to provide info on how they collect and use personal data
text: And info on how these policies affect children.

title: FTC orders ByteDance, Facebook and other tech companies to explain what they do with user data
text: The FTC is ordering the companies behind many of the largest social and video platforms to explain how they use the treasure troves of data they harvest from users. Amazon, TikTok owner ByteDance, Facebook, WhatsApp, Discord, Reddit, Snap, Twitter and YouTube were all sent the order, with a deadline set 45 days from now.

title: The FTC is ordering Amazon, Facebook, Twitter, and 6 other tech firms to share how they collect, track, and use online consumer data (AMZN, FB, TWTR, GOOGL, SNAP)
text: The US Federal Trade Commission is ordering nine tech companies to provide data to the federal agency on how they collect and use people's personal information in what is a sweeping crackdown on targeted data tracking. The FTC's order affects Amazon, TikTok's China-based parent ByteDance, Discord, Facebook, the Facebook-owned messaging service WhatsApp, Reddit, Snap, Twitter, and Google-owned YouTube, according to a Monday press release.

title: U.S. FTC seeks data on how Facebook, Twitter, TikTok and others use personal data
text: The Federal Trade Commission is seeking information from Facebook, Twitter and other social media and video streaming companies about how they use the personal information that they collect on their users, the agency said on Monday.

title: FTC orders Amazon, Facebook and others to explain how they collect and use personal data
text: Amazon, TikTok owner ByteDance, Discord, Facebook and its subsidiary WhatsApp, Reddit, Snap, Twitter and Google-owned YouTube were each sent the orders.

title: Facebook publicly launches its collaborative music video app, Collab
text: Collab, Facebook's experimental app for making collaborative music videos, is today launching out of private beta testing with a public release on the App Store. The app is one of now many projects from Facebook's internal R&D group, NPE Team, which tests out new ideas that could ultimately influence Facebook's next steps in social media.
